abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Structural
            Adjustment Credit Project for Nepal was satisfactory. The
            project achieved most of its objectives, its impact on
            institutional development has been substantial,
            sustainability is likely, and the performance of both the
            Bank and Borrower was satisfactory. Several lessons can
            learned from this project. Given the complexities of
            institution-building in Nepal, it is desirable to: 1) set
            realistic objectives about how rapidly institutions can be
            improved; 2) limit the interventions to essential key
            requirements; and 3) undertake thorough preparation and follow-up.
